name: MayRee
address: 58 E 1st St, New York, NY 10003, USA

reviews.text: Food was amazing I live between Paris and NYC and I was strongly and positively chocked by how good the food is here.

The restaurant keeps things interesting. The meals are sizeable and the servers are agreeable. The staff's happy expressions make the experience better. The workers' service care was extraordinary! The time I spent here was thoroughly enjoyable.

The Thai restaurant was clean and welcoming, creating a pleasant atmosphere from the moment I walked in. The staff were very friendly and made me feel at home, always attentive and polite. The food was great, full of authentic flavor, though some dishes were a bit too spicy for my taste. Overall, it was an excellent dining experience, and I highly recommend this place to anyone who enjoys Thai cuisine.

El restaurante tailandÃ©s estaba limpio y acogedor, creando un ambiente agradable desde el momento en que entrÃ©. El personal fue muy amable y me hizo sentir como en casa, siempre atento y cortÃ©s. La comida estuvo excelente, llena de sabor autÃ©ntico, aunque algunos platos fueron un poco picantes para mi gusto. En general, fue una experiencia gastronÃ³mica excelente y recomiendo mucho este lugar a quienes disfrutan de la comida tailandesa.

Theyâ€™ve got authentic Tom Yum soup (so hard to find!) and the special Halloween drinks are adorable! ğŸ•·ï¸ğŸ•¸ï¸ğŸ‘»

ğŸ‘»Crimson Eyes (Halloween special drink)
ğŸ•·ï¸Spiderweb Latte (Halloween special drink)
ğŸ¤Tom Yum Goong (hot & sour Thai soup)
ğŸ¤Roti Mataba (stuffed pancake)
ğŸ¤Somtum (papaya salad)
ğŸ¤Kaeng Phed Ped (roasted duck curry)
ğŸ¤Pad Pong Karee Talay (yellow curry seafood)
ğŸ¥­Mango Sticky Rice

- @GoerToEat

One of my favorite Thai spots in NYC,
Iâ€™ve been here more than 10 times!
The place has that authentic Chiang Mai vibe with enamel plates and a cozy bar-style setting.

My must-orders:
Kra Prow (Thai basil pork) â€” perfectly savory and goes so well with rice;
Somtum (papaya salad) â€” super crisp and tangy;
Duck curry with pineapple and lychee â€” surprisingly delicious combo!
The crab noodle stir-fry is also amazing â€” not too dry, not too wet, just right.

And donâ€™t skip the Thai tea â€” it used to be a bit sweet, but now itâ€™s perfectly balanced. Always my go-to comfort spot ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡­
Mayree quickly became one of my favorite Thai restaurants in the city. The flavors are bold, authentic, and beautifully balanced
Food is decently tasty. Great cocktails. Some dishes are better than others.
Good food, good environment, nice experience!

We ordered the goong chae nam pia, after eating this, me and my friend both felt not good and want to throw up. So we thought maybe we got food poisoning. Itâ€™s very salty and spicy, and the shrimp doesnâ€™t taste fresh. Not a good experience and not cheap.
ä¸è¦ç›¸ä¿¡å°çº¢ä¹¦å‘çš„ï¼ŒçœŸçš„ä¸å¥½åƒï¼ï¼ï¼
Good vibe, great food, great service. Will definitely come back.
The dishes in this Thai restaurant are very delicious, and the environment is also very good, just like eating in the garden.

ğŸ¥¢As a returning customer at MayRee, I have to say this is one of my favorite Thai restaurants! Every dish is consistently delicious, the service is warm and welcoming, and the atmosphere is upscale and spotless. Iâ€™ll definitely recommend this place to my family and friendsğŸ™ŒğŸ»

I had such an amazing dinner at Mayree. It is a small Thai restaurant in SOHO, but it can get busy and I can see why. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. It was my first time and so I usually ask the staff for recommendations and I enjoyed everything I had. Each dish had a unique flavor that I would not have expected. And I also love me a good mango sticky rice, mango was so sweet and juicy, it was the best way to end my dinner.

Kee Mao Talay - loved!!!!!! The noodles are cooked to just the right firmness.The spiciness perfectly complements the sweetness of the seafood.
Hed Tod - Mushroom lovers will enjoy this.

This place is an easy 4.9, underrated. Incredible curry all around.

Edit: and mango sticky rice my gosh!
éå¸¸æ¨èçš„æ³°é¤ æ˜¯æˆ‘å’Œæœ‹å‹é€›è¡—å¿…åƒçš„ä¸€å®¶

Scrumptious

Roti Nam w/chicken is unique and special cinnamon flavor!
Yummy! One of my fav Thai spots in the city. Good HH

Had the most incredible dinner here sharing so many delicious plates of noodles, curries and appetizers! The pad Thai had a depth of flavor I can't wait to come back for and loved how fun and special all the cocktails are! A perfect spot for the fall time!
Love the Roti nam keang!!
Really really good food. Papaya salad was stand out. Fast polite service and surprisingly inexpensive
Absolutely amazing, the service, drinks, omg the food was so delicious. I will definitely be back.

One of the best Thai restaurants in the LES. It never disappoints. The food is delicious, the drinks are amazing, and the service is very welcoming. I recommend stopping by and trying some any of its dishes because you won't be disappointed.

â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸â­ï¸
The food is absolutely delicious! We ordered Kra Praw (ground pork/chicken with rice) and Kai Pad Puu (crab meat fried rice). Both dishes were packed with flavorâ€”the spice level was just right, and the crab meat fried rice had a buttery richness that made it extra tasty. 100% recommended!

The service was also wonderfulâ€”our waitress was so kind and attentive, checking in to make sure everything was perfect. Overall, an amazing dining experience.

We loved Mayree Thai Food. The food was delicious, the atmosphere is peaceful, and the drinks are great. Hereâ€™s the list of dishes we tried that day. Weâ€™ll definitely be back.
Roti Mataba
Gai Gor Lae
Pad Mee Kati
Kaeng Phed Ped
Aperol Spritz HP
Espresso Martini HP

Excelente ambiente y sobre todo las bebidas y comida! Todo lo que probamos nos encantÃ³, personalmente el Duck and roasted pineapple with curry, es una genialidad!!! Recomendado para el que busca una comida Thai reconfortante!

Did a takeaway of the duck curry. Itâ€™s so terrible canâ€™t even chew it. Not sure if itâ€™s just because  it was a takeaway but I am having to throw it all. On the phone with seamless and they canâ€™t do anything since itâ€™s upto the customer to decide where they order from

Nice atmosphere with great authentic food. I have tried Jorang Curry and Kaprao (Thai Basil) and I can definitely tell that here we have the real Thai taste. One of my most favorite Thai restaurants so far in NYC.
Nos gustÃ³ mucho la comida, un sabor delicado y diferente, rÃ¡pido y en precios razonables. El postre de sticky rice muy sabroso. Un lugar para volver!
The best pad gra prow I've ever had. The chicken skewers were also excellent. Very cute space and nice service.
Delicious traditional Thai food. Definitely recommend!

First off, I had no idea the Thai had their own moonshine or herbal digestifs! I tried two: Stomping Horse and Elephantâ€™s Strength. Both were bold and flavorful but still pleasant to taste.

The Yum Hua Plee (banana leaf salad with pork and shrimp) was fresh and light.

The Pla Loui Suan (Branzino) was juicy, crunchy, and perfectly complimented by the mango salad that accompanied it.

The Kao Pad Puu (crab fried rice) was amazing and not wet like many other crab fried rice dishes are.

Also, one of the first Thai restaurants Iâ€™ve seen with actual Thai dinersâ€”at least three tables were Thai groups.

Overall, everything was phenomenalâ€”highly recommend!

I liked the food except ice cream because it has too much coconut. Service was excellent
P.S. we visited this place 3 more times and we still love every dish except ice cream.
Great place for more authentic Thai.  No attitude, just friendly staff, creative drinks and solid food.
Stayed in New York for a week, best meal I had
I'm in love with this place ğŸ¥° Food and service is great â¤ï¸â€¦
Good response to the customers and very friendly and the food tastes sooo good.
They never disappoint me ! Sooo good
Incredible flavors. Spice here is no joke!

The vibe is cozy and intimate â€” dim lighting, lush greenery, great for getting a little buzzed and sinking into good conversation.
My top three must-try:
Prysob: Interesting cocktail.
Kua Kling: Itâ€™s a dry pork spicy curry with bold spice and super fragrant flavors.
Park Mor: appetite
One of my fav Thai food spots! Very authentic and indeed spicy, but soo good.

The restaurant had such a warm and cozy vibe, and the food was seriously delicious. Every dish was full of flavor and beautifully presented, and the atmosphere made the whole experience even better. It felt like the perfect spot to relax, enjoy a great meal, and soak in the good energy. Iâ€™d definitely go back!

My friend recommended this spot, and I finally got to check it out on a Thursday evening. Walked in without a reservation and got lucky with a table. The ambiance is super cozy and really captures that Thai vibe with all the beautiful decor.

Our server was so friendly and helpful, even gave us some great food recommendations, and we ordered them all! We had the chicken soup, fried chicken, shrimp in fish sauce, papaya salad, crab fried rice, and minced pork with basil. Everything was delicious, but my favorites were the papaya salad and crab fried rice.

We didnâ€™t get to try the cocktails this time, but Iâ€™m definitely coming back for that on my next visit.

The location is also perfect, great spot for a full meal before bar hopping in the area.

Canâ€™t wait to come back!

Arrived on a damp June evening and were not disappointed. Amazing food, amazing staff and service in this cozy restaurant. We had Veg Spring Rolls, Green Curry, Roti Nam Keang ( Roti so good we ordered more!) and vegetable fried rice. Not forgetting  delicious Spicy Margarita! Best meal over our 5 day NYC visit! Hope to return.

The food here is absolutely delicious! I especially loved the Pad Krapow and Som Tum â€” both were full of flavor and perfectly cooked. The cocktails were also a great match with the dishes, enhancing the overall dining experience. Highly recommended!

Loved this place! The kra pow was delicious! The best one I ever have. Itâ€™s spicy, flavorful, and cooked just right. Thai iced tea was not too sweet which I like. The staff were really friendly and the vibe was relaxed and cozy. Definitely coming back.

Restaurant ThaÃ¯landais exceptionnel.

Nous prenons toujours plaisir a trouver un bon restaurant ThaÃ¯landais, L'accueil est tres chaleureux, nous avons savourÃ© absolument chaque plat du premier jusqu'au dernier. Une explosion de saveurs d'une cuisine authentique et raffinÃ©e. Un grand merci au barman qui fait des cocktails sublimes. Merci, nous reviendrons.
Very chill vibe and very delicious food. The drinks are with fare price. Good place to chat and explore foods with a good friend
This restaurant hits all the spots on being cute. I went on a hot day and felt very relaxed. The food was great, and the women that served me were very kind and paid attention. They are the sweetest.

Spice up your life! âœ¨ MayRee is a fabulous restaurant in the East Village serving up authentic Southern Thai cuisine and creative cocktails ğŸ½ï¸ ğŸ› ğŸœğŸ¹ Chef Orawan Sawangphol brings the bold flavors of her hometown in Phang Nga, Thailand, to NYC â™¥ï¸ I was recently lucky enough to be invited and loved everything about it ğŸ¤© Think vibrant dishes like Kua Kling curry with ground pork and fried egg, rich Massaman curry with roti, and refreshing banana blossom salad ğŸ› ğŸ– ğŸ¥— The intimate space is adorned with leafy plants, gold accents and traditional Thai decor creating a cozy, celebratory vibe and their cocktails are named after characters from the Thai folktale "The Twelve Sisters," featuring fresh ingredients like lemongrass, butterfly pea, and Mekhong rum ğŸŒ±ğŸ¹âœ¨ Plus they do a fab happy hour Thu-Fri 12-8pm, Sat-Sun 12-5pm and ALL DAY Mon-Wed with specials like $12 Lychee Martini, Espresso Martini and Margaritas and $9 Aperol Spritzâ€™! ğŸ™ŒğŸ¼ We got their Malai ğŸ¥¥ and Lychee MartiniğŸ¸ Hed Tod deep fried battered shimeji mushrooms ğŸ„â€ğŸŸ«  Bacon Hor Nam fried bacon-wrapped pork sausages ğŸ¥“ Kaeng Phed Ped red duck curry ğŸ› Roti Nam Keang Chicken Curry ğŸ— and Fried Ice Cream ğŸ¨ Everything we ate and sipped was SO amazing, with delicious authentic flavor combinations ğŸ˜ Itâ€™s no wonder it has consistently featured in the Michelin Guide â¤ï¸ I canâ€™t wait to come back again already! ğŸ’•

Mayree has been featured by the Michelin guide two years in a row, specializing in Southern Thai eats with bold flavors. They feature a fun drink menu, named after the â€œTwelve Sistersâ€ folktale, along with both classics like pad Thai and curries and specialities like their roast duck or sautÃ©ed vermicelli. I was personally most impressed by how tender and juicy their duck came out, paired with a savory soup! I liked the flakiness of the roti as well. The chicken skewers were fine but not overtly impressive. Also liked the flavors of the noodles, but personally prefer larger chunks of crab meat. Everything was beautifully presented! Great for a casual date or if youâ€™re just seeking some Thai eats in the city (located in East Village). Reservation not required.

My dining experience at MayRee Thai Restaurant was truly exceptional. The atmosphere inside was absolutely wonderful. The food was a culinary delight, with fresh, high-quality ingredients and expertly prepared dishes. The Pad Mee Kati, Pad Pong Karee Talay were outstanding. Their cocktail menu is also impressive, with a huge variety and fun seasonal offerings. as well as a stunning presentation of fried ice cream dessert. Highly recommended!

Mayree is a must-visit! This cozy, rustic spot serves up incredible Thai dishes. We loved the Lychee Thai Iced Tea, Murrakot, Roti Murtaba, and the Park Mor - Pillowy soft peanut dumplings. The Kaeng Phed Ped (roast duck curry) was theâ€¦

This East Village gem serves up some of the best Southern Thai food Iâ€™ve ever had! Every dish is made with so much care, and the flavors are absolutely incredible.

The cocktails are just as impressive, with a great selection and fun seasonal specials.

If youâ€™re looking for truly authentic Thai cuisine, this is the place to go.

Highly recommend! ğŸŒº

A hidden gem in the heart of the East Village! The service was prompt and attentive, with our food arriving quickly. We tried a variety of dishes, including the refreshing papaya salad, perfectly crispy fried mushrooms, and flavorful ground chicken with basil sauce. The Pad Thai was also a standout. Overall, it was a great dining experience. This spot is ideal for lunch or brunch with friends if you're craving Thai food and don't mind spending a little extra. Highly recommend!

A gem for Thai food in East Village! I was here just in time for happy hour, and the margarita was good!

The food was delicious as well. We started with the Goong Chae Nam Pla (Thai-style spicy prawn sashimi) as the appetizer. It was quite unique, but I wasnâ€™t a fan of the bitterness from the bitter melonâ€”it didnâ€™t quite complement the rest of the flavors.

For mains, we had the Kra Prow and the Kaeng Phed Ped (roasted duck curry). Both were flavorful and well-preparedâ€”the duck curry, in particular, had a rich and aromatic sauce that paired beautifully with rice.

Overall, a fantastic spot with great food, drinks, and a lively atmosphere (probably good for first date as well). Iâ€™ll definitely be back!

MayRee in New York, NY specializes in Southern Thai food and itâ€™s right in the LES! They have a cute cocktail bar to make some delicious cocktails to go with their delicious Thai food. They have a great happy hour! Mayree has the Thai classics along with some specials like the roasted duck curry. You canâ€™t go wrong here!

ğŸŒ€Malai(à¸¡à¸²à¸¥à¸±à¸¢)- Malibu Coconut Rum/Homemade Coconut mixed/Pineapple juice/
Topped Maekhong Rum and Coconut
IceCream

ğŸŒ€Lumpao (à¸¥à¸³à¹€à¸ à¸²)- Phraya Rum/Peychaud's Bitter/ Pineapple juice/Lime juice/syrup

ğŸŒ€KAENG PHED PED- Roasted duck curry with pineapple, lychee, tomato, chili paste and coconut milk served with jasmine rice

ğŸŒ€BACON HOR NAM/ Deep fried Thai pork sausages wrapped with bacon served with sweet chili sauce

ğŸŒ€SOMTUM- Papaya salad with green papaya, tomato, chili, peanut, string beans, fresh lime juice with a choice of Original style with dried shrimp or Esan style with fermented fish sauce and salted crab

ğŸŒ€PAD KEE MAO- Stir fried wide noodle with egg, bell pepper, onion, fresh chili and fresh basil

This low-key Thai restaurant has quietly earned recognition, being featured in the Michelin Guide for two years in a row since its opening. Nestled on a quiet street in the East Village, MayRee offers a homey and authentic Southern Thai cuisine.

In my opinion, most Thai restaurants in NYC are either "good" or "very good," and MayRee easily falls into the "very good" category, with its delicious food, drinks, and warm service.

ï¼ŠPark Mor $15 **
I always order park mor, a sweet peanut steamed dumpling, whenever I spot it on the menu, as it's a rare find. It quickly became our favorite dish of the night. The chewy dumpling skin encased a peanut filling that was crunchy, sweet and savory. The dumplings were also beautifully presented in shades of blue and white.

ï¼ŠSomtum $16
My all-time favorite thai appetizer. Crunchy, tangy and refreshing. Be warnedâ€”they really mean it when they say "medium spicy".

ï¼ŠKaeng Phed Ped $31**
We've had crispy duck curry at several Thai spots, and this one served the most tender duck by far. The curry was addictive, with pineapple, lychee, and cherry tomatoes simmered in the rich and spicy curry sauce. We couldnâ€™t stop digging into the dishâ€”it was that delicious.

ï¼ŠPad Mee Kati $27
It was a southern thai style sautÃ©ed vermicelli noodles, topped with lump crab meat and omelette. Not only was it picture-perfect, but it was also absolutely delicious. I especially enjoyed the thin, chewy noodles.

ï¼ŠFried Ice Cream $12
Undoubtedly a showstopper. I was stunned to see the ice cream not melting in the fried ice cream! It was coated in breadcrumbs, garnished with coconut flakes and chocolate drizzle. Then the server set it aflame, turning it into a mini fire show. The crust did have a taste of alcohol for the flaming purpose, and was a tad too thick for my liking.

ï¼ŠLychee Thai Tea $6
Very refreshing and served with real lychee. Less heavy than an actual thai iced tea because it didnâ€™t have milk in it.

ï¼ŠPrysob (Mekhong rum, mango, lime, honey) $17
Our server strong recommended this cocktail to us. It was served with a slice of dried mango. Sweet and tropical. I personally disliked alcohol, but this drink was so smooth and sweet that I would have thought it was just a juice!!

This place took me right back to Thailand

The food, cocktails, service and staff were top notch and SO GOOD. I dropped in randomly for dinner and was immediately seated. Sek was attentive and on top of my dairy allergy when it came to recommendations.

The drinks were so unique, priced around $15 each and they have a happy hour.

We are definitely coming back.

Mayree aka Drunk Girl in Thai is exactly what youâ€™ll be with the vast selection of cocktails & even house made wines etc. The ambience is incredible; one of royalty & coziness. A nook escape in the heart of Manhattan. Iâ€™m a spicy lover & they know how to tickle
your tastebuds here with their GOONG CHAE NAM PLA,
Thai style spicy prawns sashimi, omg so spicy, snappy, chewy & delish! Only dare try if you can handle the spice but everyone should experience it along with Grilled Shrimp Mango Salad, so refreshingly spicy, I couldnâ€™t stop eating it! We also opted for the PAD PED KRA DOOK MOO, tender, savory & spicy. PAD MEE KATI was such a uniquely presented dish, so delicious, intricate with different additives to incorporate in each bite + a dried dipping chili which was magnificent & a beautifully presented mango sticky rice for dessert obviously. Mayree was a 10|10 for me & will be for you as well.

You will overall enjoy your meal here. Delicious duck red curry. Properly crispy duck, not too sweet of a curry, but still fruity. papaya salad was okay. Im sure other dishes are also quite good, i didnt try much. The food here is NOT naturally spicy like the way Som Tum Der is. If you want spicy you have to ask, even if it says spicy on the menu, it won't be.

This restaurant was SO good. Loved the ambiance, decor, and staff was very friendly. We ordered the Roti Mataba as an appetizer and Pad Mee Kati and Roti Nam Keang (phone did not eat first) for main courses. 100% recommend!

Pad ped kra dook moo was one dimensional, had a fermented fish sauce flavor but nothing to balance it out.

Pad kra prow itself was good, but imo not any better than your standard thai place.

Favorite dish was the roti nam keang, but we ordered that with beef which was very dry and not worth the extra cost.

Jor rang was also good, yet the shrimp itself was exceedingly dry!

Lastly, every dish came out lukewarm, not hot.

Overall I'd skip this place. Mediocre and overpriced. Maybe if each dish was $10 cheaper it'd be worth it.

Mayree Thai is an absolute gem for authentic Southern Thai cuisine! As soon as I walked in, I could tell this was going to be special. The flavors were so authentic and exactly what I was craving!

We started with the Park Mor, delicate rice dumplings with the perfect mix of savory and sweetâ€”such a unique appetizer that I highly recommend. The Tom Yum Soup was exactly what I needed in NYCâ€™s freezing weatherâ€”warming, spicy, and tangy with just the right kick.

For mains, the Pad Thai wrapped in an omelette was rich, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The Pad Kraw Pao was another standoutâ€”spicy, fragrant, and served with a crispy fried egg that made it the ultimate comfort dish.

And the real showstopper? The fried ice cream, torched tableside for that perfect crispy-meets-creamy texture. Such a fun and delicious way to end the meal!

Service was warm and welcoming, and the attention to detail in every dish was incredible. If you love Thai food, Mayree Thai is a must-visit. Canâ€™t wait to come back!

Dive into the vibrant flavors of Southern Thailand right in the heart of the East Village! MayRee. This cozy and charming spot is my latest culinary gem, serving up authentic dishes that transport your taste buds to the streets of Thailand. My absolute favorites? The Branzino Pla Lui Suanâ€”a perfect balance of tangy, spicy, and savoryâ€”and the sautÃ©ed vermicelli Pad Mee Kati, which is so flavorful with the lump crab meat. Trust me, this is a must-visit for any Thai food lover! ğŸŒ¶ï¸ğŸŸ

We ordered â¤µï¸
-Tom yum Goong soup
-Yum Hua Plee salad
-Pla Loui Suan Branzino
-Pad mee Kati- sautÃ©ed vermicelli
-Malai
-Kesaorn
-Mango sticky rice

Follow @spinx17 for more NYC food recs!

This place is Heaven on earth. Prepare for a wait, but it is totally worth it. Such a cute ambiance- perfect for smaller groups. The food and cocktails are PHENOMENAL. I second that this is the best pad Thai in the city if not the world. Highly recommend the duck curry too. A must try, canâ€™t wait to go back! PS trust the hype - Gigi is even better than the reviews say!

Decided to check out Mayree after the Lunar New Year parade in Chinatown and boy were we pleased.  From the service, to the food, to the drinks, everything was spectacular.  Extremely creative and tasty dishes, same goes for the drinks.  Presentation was amazing and while I just started learning Thai cuisine, I felt comfortable asking questions and ordering from the menu. We also got to try Thai moonshine and went for a second round.  Prices are very reasonable.  Will be coming back for sure!

Overall it's a nice Thai restaurant, but not really to my taste.

Roasted duck was ok, very little duck.
Shrimp pad thai surprisingly has a egg omelet kinda wrap. The taste is on the sour (authentic) side. I personally don't like it very much but my friends liked it a lot.
Crab fried rice has a very good texture, but not very savory enough.
Mongo sticky rice was very good ğŸ‘

I went there with my friend for lunch. Walk-in no reserve. The place is super cute with nice interior and lots of plants. We got the Tom yum soup, pineapple duck curry (super tasty with fruity and coconutty hints), basil pork with rice (so flavorful and well cooked). We enjoyed all dishes. For its serving size, the price is on the higher end but the flavor makes up for it:))

I had dinner at MayRee last Thursday, the food was excellent and the staff was attentive and friendly, always checking in to make sure everything was perfect. The restaurantâ€™s warm lighting and tasteful decor added to the experience

Mayree, a Michelin-recommended spot, is a must for Southern Thai cuisine. The MalÃ©e hibiscus cocktail and Morrakot with sake and coconut milk were fantastic. The Hed Tod mushrooms and Park Mor butterfly pea dumplings were standouts. Be sure to try the Pad Mee Kati with crab and the crispy Gai Tod Had Yai chicken!

We were appealed by Mayree from its great reviews on google and itâ€™s also in Michelin guide.

They use lots of greens for decorating with limited table. Itâ€™s crowded when we visited
on a weekend lunch time.

They serve mainly Southern cuisine in Thailand with various options. My personal favorite was their green curry which was rich and creamy with flavorful ingredients.

Fried chicken was cooked properly, crispy and juicy inside. My roommate loved their two dipping sauces which were appetizing.
Mayree is amazing. The food, the energy, the drinks. The flavors were beautiful and so was the presentation. Canâ€™t wait to go back

Food was so nice and the portions really good. Love the fish with mango so much.

Very good Thai food! I had the duck with pineapple and lychee and loved it. It wasn't too sweet and also a bit spicy, so just the right balance! It's very good value for money, too. Would recommend to go here if you're in the area and looking for some delicious Thai food ğŸ˜‹

The chicken wings were ridiculous. Wish this place was more accessible to me because I'd order them all the time. Duck curry was flavorful and a good balance of spicy and sweet. The crab fried rice and spring rolls were also delicious. Shame the bar seating wasn't the most comfortable, but my experience overall was a good one. Thanks for the food!

MayRee is a gem for authentic Thai cuisine with a modern twist. We started with crispy Hed Tod mushrooms with sweet chili sauce and the Somtum papaya salad, both bursting with fresh flavors. For mains, the Pad Thai Hor Khai, wrapped in a delicate omelet, and the rich Kaeng Phed Ped duck curry were exceptional.

The cocktails were a highlight, especially the Morrakot, with sake, vodka-infused lemongrass, and coconut milk, and the indulgent Thai Tea Tikki Coco, topped with coconut flakes and edible gold leaf.

Celebrating Pride Month, the â€˜Proud to be Prideâ€™ cocktailâ€”a blend of gin, elderflower, and prosecco is def a must!

With top-notch ambiance, service, and unforgettable dishes, MayRee is a must-visit!
